title: Russia Looks to Private Militia to Secure a Victory in Eastern Ukraine
description: Wagner Group forces launched attacks from several directions on the city of Bakhmut, though analysts said seizing it would yield little strategic value.

title: A Championship Season in Mariachi Country
description: Every year along the Texas border, high school teams battle it out in one of the nation’s most intense championship rivalries. But they’re not playing football.

title: Your Monday Briefing: COP27 Begins
description: Plus India could be key to peace in Ukraine and a child’s death in China sparks new outrage over the zero Covid policy.

title: Michael Basman, Chess Master Known for ‘Bad’ Openings, Dies at 76
description: His opening repertoire was often successful. But it should have carried a label: “Do not try these at home (or at least not in important competitions).”

title: Russian State Media Confirms That a Top General Is No Longer in His Post
description: Col. Gen. Alexander Lapin had been publicly bashed by a close ally of President Vladimir V. Putin over his performance in Ukraine.

title: Climate Conference to Debate Whether Rich Nations Will Pay for Damage
description: For the first time, the conference agenda will officially include the divisive issue of compensation by large nations responsible for the bulk of emissions.

title: Ela Bhatt, Advocate for Women Workers in India, Dies at 89
description: The cooperative she founded has helped millions of women who had never before had a safety net. “They were,” she said, “the poorest among the poor.”

title: Taiwan’s Bomb Shelters: ‘A Space for Life. And a Space for Death.’
description: Preparing for war over hundreds of years has left a mark on the island, with its hundreds of bomb shelters. Some are being turned into cultural oases.

title: Iran Acknowledges Sending Drones to Russia, but Says This Preceded War
description: Russia has used Iranian-made drones in a series of deadly strikes on Ukrainian cities, according to Ukrainian and Western officials.

title: What’s at Stake
description: Tuesday’s elections will determine the next two years of President Biden’s agenda — and shape the future of democracy.

title: Could India Help Broker Peace in Ukraine?
description: India has good relations with both Russia and the West, and seeks a more muscular role in geopolitics. The biggest obstacle is that Ukrainians and Russians don’t want to talk.

title: Somalis Are Going Hungry. Their Government Isn’t Calling It a Famine.
description: Humanitarian groups say Somalia’s leaders are resisting a formal declaration of famine that could unlock aid and save lives.

title: Russia Reactivates Its Trolls and Bots Ahead of Tuesday’s Midterms
description: Researchers have identified a series of Russian information operations to influence American elections and, perhaps, erode support for Ukraine.

title: At COP27, Developing Nations Have a Message for Polluters: Pay Up
description: Poor countries facing climate hazards want the United States and other industrialized nations to compensate them for the harm caused by greenhouse gases.

title: As Russia’s Military Reputation Takes a Hit, Its Arms Sales Are Likely to Suffer
description: Russia is still the world’s second-largest arms exporter but its performance on the battlefield in Ukraine, coupled with Western sanctions, is likely to hurt its ability to sell weapons.

title: The War in Ukraine Could Dent Russia’s Clout as an Arms Dealer
description: Analysts say Russia’s performance in Ukraine, coupled with Western sanctions, is likely to hurt its ability to sell weapons abroad. Southeast Asia is a case in point.
